With `-bb` the warnings turn into exceptions and I can't even run my code :(
title: BytesWarning: Comparison between bytes and string

text:
So? Why would you need to run your code with `-b` or `-bb`?
I'm sorry, I just don't follow your concern. This is intended behavior â€” `command` is expected to be either
`str` or `bytes` instance and I don't want to do repeat same checkes/encoding.

Say I want to check my own code for errors about mixing bytes and str.  I turn on `-b`.  Now I am  spammed  by warnings from aioredis.  If I run with `-bb` to make sure no unicode bugs creep up in production, I get crashes from aioredis.

It's kind of a "code smell" that `command` can be either str or bytes, imho.  You should just pick one and stick with it.
